agent_profile_summary: Carlos Duran, a 40-year-old Dominican-born resident of the Bronx, has spent his life navigating the challenges of poverty, family responsibility, and self-reliance. Growing up in a small apartment on Elmwood Avenue, he faced the loss of his father and the burden of his motherâ€™s long hours working two jobs to keep them afloat. At 18, he made a defining choice to pursue education part-time while working nights at a bodega, a decision that eventually led him to a graduate degree and a stable career in a local warehouse. Today, he continues to care for his aging mother, balancing work, health struggles, and community involvement, such as volunteering at his church. His life is shaped by a quiet determination to provide for his family and a deep connection to his roots, which influence his values, his resilience, and the way he relates to others with a sense of shared struggle and mutual support.
